intro: Saurauia villosa, commonly known as the woolly saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Saurauia villosa produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
